glsa.title: PEAR XML-RPC, phpxmlrpc: New PHP script injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: The PEAR XML-RPC and phpxmlrpc libraries allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP script commands.

background.p: The PEAR XML-RPC and phpxmlrpc libraries are both PHP implementations of the XML-RPC protocol.

description.p: Stefan Esser of the Hardened-PHP Project discovered that the PEAR XML-RPC and phpxmlrpc libraries were improperly handling XMLRPC requests and responses with malformed nested tags.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary PHP script code into eval() statements by sending a specially crafted XML document to web applications making use of these libraries.

workaround.p: There are no known workarounds at this time.
